segment.source: App-V Upgrade Checklist
segment.target: App-V Upgrade Checklist

segment.source: App-V Upgrade Checklist
segment.target: App-V Upgrade Checklist

segment.source: App-V Upgrade Checklist
segment.target: App-V Upgrade Checklist

segment.source: Before trying to upgrade to Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 or later versions, any version earlier than App-V 4.1 must be upgraded to App-V 4.1.
segment.target: Before trying to upgrade to Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 or later versions, any version earlier than App-V 4.1 must be upgraded to App-V 4.1.

segment.source: You should plan to upgrade clients first, and then upgrade the server components.
segment.target: You should plan to upgrade clients first, and then upgrade the server components.

segment.source: App-V clients that have been upgraded to App-V 4.5 continue to work with App-V servers that have not yet been upgraded.
segment.target: App-V clients that have been upgraded to App-V 4.5 continue to work with App-V servers that have not yet been upgraded.

segment.source: Earlier versions of the client are not supported on servers that have been upgraded to App-V 4.5.
segment.target: Earlier versions of the client are not supported on servers that have been upgraded to App-V 4.5.

segment.source: Step
segment.target: Step

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: Upgrade the App-V clients.
segment.target: Upgrade the App-V clients.

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Client

segment.source: Upgrade the App-V servers and database.
segment.target: Upgrade the App-V servers and database.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you have more than one server sharing access to the App-V database, all those servers must be taken offline while the database is being upgraded.
segment.target: If you have more than one server sharing access to the App-V database, all those servers must be taken offline while the database is being upgraded.

segment.source: You should follow your regular business practices for the database upgrade, but we recommend that you test the database upgrade by using a backup copy of the database first on a test server.
segment.target: You should follow your regular business practices for the database upgrade, but we recommend that you test the database upgrade by using a backup copy of the database first on a test server.

segment.source: Then, you should select one of the servers for the first upgrade, which will upgrade the database schema.
segment.target: Then, you should select one of the servers for the first upgrade, which will upgrade the database schema.

segment.source: After the production database has been successfully upgraded, you can upgrade the App-V software on the other servers.
segment.target: After the production database has been successfully upgraded, you can upgrade the App-V software on the other servers.

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components

segment.source: Upgrade the App-V Management Web Service.
segment.target: Upgrade the App-V Management Web Service.

segment.source: This step applies only if the Management Web Service is on a separate server, which would require that you run the server installer program on that separate server to upgrade the Management Web service.
segment.target: This step applies only if the Management Web Service is on a separate server, which would require that you run the server installer program on that separate server to upgrade the Management Web service.

segment.source: Otherwise, the previous server upgrade step will automatically upgrade the Management Web Service.
segment.target: Otherwise, the previous server upgrade step will automatically upgrade the Management Web Service.

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components

segment.source: Upgrade the App-V Management Console.
segment.target: Upgrade the App-V Management Console.

segment.source: This step applies only if the Management Console is on a separate computer, which would require that you run the server installer program on that separate computer to upgrade the console.
segment.target: This step applies only if the Management Console is on a separate computer, which would require that you run the server installer program on that separate computer to upgrade the console.

segment.source: Otherwise, the previous server upgrade step will upgrade the Management Console.
segment.target: Otherwise, the previous server upgrade step will upgrade the Management Console.

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components

segment.source: Upgrade the App-V Sequencer.
segment.target: Upgrade the App-V Sequencer.

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: Additional Upgrade Considerations
segment.target: Additional Upgrade Considerations

segment.source: Any virtual application packages sequenced in version 4.2 will not have to be sequenced again for use with version 4.5.
segment.target: Any virtual application packages sequenced in version 4.2 will not have to be sequenced again for use with version 4.5.

segment.source: However, you should consider upgrading the virtual packages to the Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 format if you want to apply default access control lists (ACLs) or generate a Windows Installer file.
segment.target: However, you should consider upgrading the virtual packages to the Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 format if you want to apply default access control lists (ACLs) or generate a Windows Installer file.

segment.source: This is a simple process and requires only that the existing virtual application package be opened and saved with the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.
segment.target: This is a simple process and requires only that the existing virtual application package be opened and saved with the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.

segment.source: This can be automated by using the App-VSequencer command-line interface.
segment.target: This can be automated by using the App-VSequencer command-line interface.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Create or Upgrade Virtual Applications Using the App-V Sequencer
segment.target: For more information, see How to Create or Upgrade Virtual Applications Using the App-V Sequencer

segment.source: One of the features of the 4.5 Sequencer is the ability to create Windows Installer (.msi) files as control points for virtual application package interoperability with electronic software distribution (ESD) systems, such as Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: One of the features of the 4.5 Sequencer is the ability to create Windows Installer (.msi) files as control points for virtual application package interoperability with electronic software distribution (ESD) systems, such as Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: Previous Windows Installer files created with the MSI tool for Application Virtualization that were installed on a App-V 4.1 or 4.2 client that is subsequently upgraded to App-V 4.5 will continue to work, although they cannot be installed on the App-V 4.5 client.
segment.target: Previous Windows Installer files created with the MSI tool for Application Virtualization that were installed on a App-V 4.1 or 4.2 client that is subsequently upgraded to App-V 4.5 will continue to work, although they cannot be installed on the App-V 4.5 client.

segment.source: However, they cannot be removed or upgraded unless they are upgraded in the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.
segment.target: However, they cannot be removed or upgraded unless they are upgraded in the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.

segment.source: The original App-V package earlier than 4.5 has to be opened in the App-V 4.5 Sequencer and then saved as a Windows Installer File.
segment.target: The original App-V package earlier than 4.5 has to be opened in the App-V 4.5 Sequencer and then saved as a Windows Installer File.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the App-V 4.2 Client has already been upgraded to App-V 4.5, it is possible to script a workaround to preserve the version 4.2 packages on version 4.5 clients and allow them to be managed.
segment.target: If the App-V 4.2 Client has already been upgraded to App-V 4.5, it is possible to script a workaround to preserve the version 4.2 packages on version 4.5 clients and allow them to be managed.

segment.source: This script must copy two files, msvcp71.dll and msvcr71.dll, to the App-V installation folder and set the following registry key values under the registry key:HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5ClientConfiguration:
segment.target: This script must copy two files, msvcp71.dll and msvcr71.dll, to the App-V installation folder and set the following registry key values under the registry key:HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5ClientConfiguration:

segment.source: "ClientVersion"="4.2.1.20"
segment.target: "ClientVersion"="4.2.1.20"

segment.source: "GlobalDataDirectory"="C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersDocuments" (a globally writeable location)
segment.target: "GlobalDataDirectory"="C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersDocuments" (a globally writeable location)

segment.source: Windows Installer files generated by the App-V 4.5 Sequencer display the error message "This package requires Microsoft Application Virtualization Client 4.5 or later" when trying to run them on an App-V 4.6 Client.
segment.target: Windows Installer files generated by the App-V 4.5 Sequencer display the error message "This package requires Microsoft Application Virtualization Client 4.5 or later" when trying to run them on an App-V 4.6 Client.

segment.source: Open the old package with either the App-V 4.5 SP1 Sequencer or the App-V 4.6 Sequencer and generate a new .msi file for the package.
segment.target: Open the old package with either the App-V 4.5 SP1 Sequencer or the App-V 4.6 Sequencer and generate a new .msi file for the package.

segment.source: Any version 4.2 reports that were created and saved will be overwritten when the server is upgraded to version 4.5.
segment.target: Any version 4.2 reports that were created and saved will be overwritten when the server is upgraded to version 4.5.

segment.source: If you have to keep these reports, you must save a backup copy of the SftMMC.msc file located in the SoftGrid Management Console folder on the server and use that copy to replace the new SftMMC.msc that is installed during the upgrade.
segment.target: If you have to keep these reports, you must save a backup copy of the SftMMC.msc file located in the SoftGrid Management Console folder on the server and use that copy to replace the new SftMMC.msc that is installed during the upgrade.

segment.source: For additional information about upgrading from previous versions, see Upgrading to Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 FAQ (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=120358).
segment.target: For additional information about upgrading from previous versions, see Upgrading to Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 FAQ (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=120358).

segment.source: App-V 4.6 Client Package Support
segment.target: App-V 4.6 Client Package Support

segment.source: You can deploy packages created in previous versions of App-V to App-V 4.6 clients.
segment.target: You can deploy packages created in previous versions of App-V to App-V 4.6 clients.

segment.source: However, you must modify the associated .osd file so that it includes the appropriate operating system and chip architecture information.
segment.target: However, you must modify the associated .osd file so that it includes the appropriate operating system and chip architecture information.

segment.source: The following values can be used:
segment.target: The following values can be used:

segment.source: OS Value
segment.target: OS Value

segment.source: OS VALUE=”Win2003TS”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”Win2003TS”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”Win2003TS64”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”Win2003TS64”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”Win2008TS”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”Win2008TS”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”Win2008TS64”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”Win2008TS64”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”Win2008R2TS64”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”Win2008R2TS64”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”Win7”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”Win7”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”Win764”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”Win764”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”WinVista”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”WinVista”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”WinVista64”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”WinVista64”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”WinXP”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”WinXP”/

segment.source: OS VALUE=”WinXP64”/
segment.target: OS VALUE=”WinXP64”/

segment.source: To run a newly created 32-bit package, you must sequence the application on a computer running a 32-bit operating system with the App-V 4.6 Sequencer installed.
segment.target: To run a newly created 32-bit package, you must sequence the application on a computer running a 32-bit operating system with the App-V 4.6 Sequencer installed.

segment.source: After you have sequenced the application, in the Sequencer console, click the Deployment tab and then specify the appropriate operating system and chip architecture as required.
segment.target: After you have sequenced the application, in the Sequencer console, click the Deployment tab and then specify the appropriate operating system and chip architecture as required.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Applications sequenced on a computer running a 64-bit operating system must be deployed to computers running a 64-bit operating system.
segment.target: Applications sequenced on a computer running a 64-bit operating system must be deployed to computers running a 64-bit operating system.

segment.source: New 32-bit packages created by using the App-V 4.6 Sequencer do not run on computers running the App-V 4.5 client.
segment.target: New 32-bit packages created by using the App-V 4.6 Sequencer do not run on computers running the App-V 4.5 client.

segment.source: To run new 64-bit packages on the App-V 4.6 Client, you must sequence the application on a computer running the App-V 4.6 Sequencer and that is running a 64-bit operating system.
segment.target: To run new 64-bit packages on the App-V 4.6 Client, you must sequence the application on a computer running the App-V 4.6 Sequencer and that is running a 64-bit operating system.

segment.source: After you have sequenced the application, in the Sequencer console, click the Deployment tab, and then specify the appropriate operating system and chip architecture as required.
segment.target: After you have sequenced the application, in the Sequencer console, click the Deployment tab, and then specify the appropriate operating system and chip architecture as required.

segment.source: The following table lists which client versions will run packages created by using the various versions of the sequencer.
segment.target: The following table lists which client versions will run packages created by using the various versions of the sequencer.

segment.source: Sequenced by using the App-V 4.2 Sequencer
segment.target: Sequenced by using the App-V 4.2 Sequencer

segment.source: Sequenced by using the App-V 4.5 Sequencer
segment.target: Sequenced by using the App-V 4.5 Sequencer

segment.source: Sequenced by using the 32-bit App-V 4.6 Sequencer
segment.target: Sequenced by using the 32-bit App-V 4.6 Sequencer

segment.source: Sequenced by using the 64-bit App-V 4.6 Sequencer
segment.target: Sequenced by using the 64-bit App-V 4.6 Sequencer

segment.source: 4.2 Client
segment.target: 4.2 Client

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.target: 4.5 Client ¹

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: 4.6 Client (32-bit)
segment.target: 4.6 Client (32-bit)

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.source: 4.6 Client (64-bit)
segment.target: 4.6 Client (64-bit)

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: Yes
segment.target: Yes

segment.source: ¹Applies to all versions of the App-V 4.5 client, including App-V 4.5, App-V 4.5 CU1, and App-V 4.5 SP1.
segment.target: ¹Applies to all versions of the App-V 4.5 client, including App-V 4.5, App-V 4.5 CU1, and App-V 4.5 SP1.
